metadata.title: CVE-2018-20781 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In pam/gkr-pam-module.c in GNOME Keyring before 3.27.2, the user's passwordis kept in a session-child process spawned from the LightDM daemon. Thiscan expose the credential in cleartext.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20781` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnome-keyring - 3.18.3-0ubuntu2.1
libp11-kit-gnome-keyring - 3.18.3-0ubuntu2.1
libpam-gnome-keyring - 3.18.3-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnome-keyring package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.18.3-0ubuntu2.1').
